page.title: 04HOP GROWING HORTON KIRBY
page.content: Hop fields and oast houses are a distinctive feature of the Kent countryside. Records indicate that hops were first used for beer making in 1524, although much earlier the Romans used hops in salads. The hop plant takes 5 years to become established but can then remain in use for a further 25 years. In this time 60 ft. root systems can be grown. In February new string is put into the framework of poles and wires which support the bines. In April the bines are trained by hand, and then twice more in May and June. The crop is harvested in August by cutting down the bines. The hops are then stripped by machine and placed in pockets. From 24 acres at{Court Lodge {Farm}180 pockets are collected.
